content: नम् {c1c} <ab>P.</ab> sometimes <ab>A.</ab> (नमति-ते, ननाम, अनंसीत्, नंस्यति, नत; {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} नमयति-ते or नामयति-ते, but with a preposition नमयति only; {%<ab>desid.</ab>%} निनंसति) {@--1@} To bow to, make obeisance to, salute (as a mark of respect) (with <ab>acc.</ab> or <ab>dat.</ab>); इयं नमति वः सर्वान् त्रिलोचनवधूरिति <ls>Ku. 6. 89</ls>; <ls>Bg. 11. 37</ls>; <ls>Bk. 9. 51</ls>, <ls n="Bk.">10. 31</ls>; <ls n="Bk.">12. 39</ls>; <ls>Śi. 4. 57.</ls> {@--2@} To submit or subject oneself, bow down; अशक्तः संधिमान् नमेत् <ls>Kām. 8. 55.</ls> {@--3@} To bend, sink; go down; अनंसीद्भूर्भरेणास्य <ls>Bk. 15. 25.</ls> नेमुः सर्वदिशः <ls>K. 55</ls>; उन्नमति नमति वर्षति…मेघः <ls>Mk. 5. 26.</ls> {@--4@} To stoop, be inclined. {@--5@} To be bent or curved. {@--6@} To sound. {@--7@} To change a dental to a lingual letter. {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} {@--1@} To bend, make curved. {@--2@} To bend (as a bow); <ls>Ś. 2. 3.</ls> {@--3@} To cause to sink. {@--4@} To prevent, ward off.
